<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: 
try {
    byte[] content = new byte[binSize];
    int bytesRead = 0;
    while (bytesRead < binSize) {
        int result = stream.read(content, bytesRead, binSize - bytesRead);
        if (result == -1) break; // end of stream
        bytesRead += result;
    }
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The InputStream.read(byte[] b, int off, int len) method attempts to read up to len bytes of data into the array b from the input stream, starting at the array position given by off. This method blocks until at least one byte of data is read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown. If the first read operation returns -1, then the end of the stream has been reached. If the first read operation returns any other value, then subsequent read operations will attempt to read the remaining bytes. If the total number of bytes read into the array is less than the requested len, then there is a chance that the end of the stream has been reached and more data will not be available.
